H0.text: The world's first publicly subscribed passenger railway, the Stockton and Darlington, opened in England with steam engines when. 1804

H1.text: The world's first publicly subscribed passenger railway, the Stockton and Darlington, opened in England with steam engines when. 1815

H2.text: The world's first publicly subscribed passenger railway, the Stockton and Darlington, opened in England with steam engines when. 1820

H3.text: The world's first publicly subscribed passenger railway, the Stockton and Darlington, opened in England with steam engines when. 1825

A4.text: The Stockton and Darlington Railway was officially opened on 27 September 1825.

A5.text: The world's first public railway to use steam locomotives, its first line connected collieries near Shildon with Darlington and Stockton in County Durham, and was officially opened on 27 September 1825.
